title: What if the "Golden Demon"(Jhin) was in the PROJECT: OVERDRIVE trailer?
body: When you watch the PROJECT: OVERDRIVE trailer in the video there is this mysteries figure when Master Yi was having a flashback. You might think it was just a random character in the trailer, but when you read through Jhin's lore before he used a gun he was known as the "Golden Demon". What if Master Yi's flashback was a flashback of when the "Golden Demon" attacked Yi's village, and it revealed Jhin(the Golden Demon) before he was announced?

replies.body:
Really unlikely considering that the samurai from the project video looks like a big muscular warrior who seemingly brought destruction to Yis entire hometown.
Jhin on the other hand is pretty lean and is a serial killer who used to kill his victims with knives and without any witnesses.
Unlikely Jhin was not a samurai demon warrior and is likely not proficient at wielding  swords.  Yi's village was wiped out by bio-chemical weapons produced by Noxus.

Well he did use knives originally and he is known to be a natural genius in a lot of categories,so it wouldn't be off for him to be also good with swords.

But I agree with the rest of your post.
i thought the demon was supposed to represent zed?

> [{quoted}](name=reaperteaser,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=9EpMdqMz,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2016-11-06T04:17:16.785+0000)
>
> i thought the demon was supposed to represent zed?

No if you read through Jhin's lore he was known as the "Golden Demon".
i was thinking that because zed was the bad guy in the video

> [{quoted}](name=reaperteaser,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=9EpMdqMz,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2016-11-06T09:21:30.250+0000)
>
> i was thinking that because zed was the bad guy in the video

I can see how you got mixed up between the two of them. Yi sees the mysterious figure as Zed but Zed isn't the mysterious figure.

Unlikely considering Jhin's mental problems are so subversive that you'd never really expect him to be insane just looking at him, as such he probably didn't even use a disguise and just lured people in with his charisma alone to butcher.
Jhin started off killing people with knives, then it moved to his gun Whisper once the Ionian government (or a few certain corrupt /malicious members) set him free.
